title: Kansas City Public Library trolls Blue Jays on Twitter
text:
Kansas City Public Library trolls Blue Jays on Twitter Kansas City Public Library trolls Blue Jays on Twitter 
Oct 21, 2015; Toronto, Ontario, CAN; Toronto Blue Jays shortstop Troy Tulowitzki (2) and second baseman Ryan Goins (17) react after the victory against the Kansas City Royals in game five of the ALCS at Rogers Centre. (John E. Sokolowski/USA Today Sports) Like Sports News on Facebook: By Todd DeweyLas   
If the Toronto Blue Jays complete their comeback from a 3-1 deficit to beat the Kansas City Royals in the American League Championship Series, the Kansas City Public Library will surely incur the wrath of superstitious Royals fans. 
Following K.C.'s 14-2 romp in Tuesday's Game 4, the library jabbed the Blue Jays on Twitter , posting an image of three books stacked on top of each other that read, "Canada. Sorry you lost. What bluebirds do." 
The Toronto Public Library responded Wednesday morning with an image of a stack of books that read, "Warning. Kansas City. It ain't over till it's over." That's how you debate! 
The Blue Jays bounced back to win Game 5, 7-1, on Wednesday afternoon. The Kansas City library should know better than to tempt fate. The Royals are one of 12 teams to erase a 3-1 deficit to win a postseason series, rallying past Toronto in 1985. Â— KCMO Public Library (@KCLibrary) October 20, 2015 Well played @KCLibrary but we've got a way with words too. 'Til tomorrow! @BlueJays #ComeTOgether #GoJaysGo pic.twitter.com/qED5PFp95t
